channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping outside property on the footpath, 11th June
item.description:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to bring to your attention an ongoing issue of fly-tipping outside 34 Hamlet Road, which has persisted over the past few months. There has been increased activity from delivery motorcycles near the property, and on several occasions, rubbish has been left on the public footpath where they tend to park. While the vehicles move on, the litter remains, creating an eyesore and potential health hazard for residents and passers-by. We kindly request that the Council arrange for the removal of the existing rubbish and consider any appropriate measures to prevent recurrence. Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Hamlet Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous Flytipping fallen on street., 11th June
item.description:
Hello, the Flytipping at the bottom albatross street has grown, and is blocking the pavement. This is now dangerous as the units are breaking up and fronts are falling off the tall drawers. Yesterday I saw someone having to move fallen debris to try to get past. Please can this be removed and the landlord/residents fined as per the posters. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albatross Street, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Vehicle with no plates - abandoned, 11th June
item.description:
This vehicle has been sat outside 10 Tredown Road SE26 5QH for over 10 days, and no one has moved it in that time. It has no number plates on front or rear. Nobody on our street knows this vehicle or the owner.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Tredown Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter in the park next to a public bin, 11th June
item.description:
Rubbish is taking out of the bin by animals and spread around the park and next to that bin. These type of buns and other opened bins like in the Harvingtons park playground are not suitable for the parks. Wild animals and birds and taking rubbish out and spread it everywhere. Every morning the park and playground looks like landfill.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Eden Park Road, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 11th June
item.description:
Car has been abandoned without tax or MOT in a public road for weeks. It is parked in a difficult spot on the road and is causing difficulties for passing traffic, especially being opposite a nursery entrance. Please can the council investigate and have it removed? Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Lane, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
